result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine D Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with Nicole G.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - (nonworking hours) STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the  Huber/or straight time
To be performed as a Condition of Probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine D Washington

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
from the Defendant's wife filed by Defense
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Antoine D Washington in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in.  
 
Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- 90 days jail straight time STAYED for one year Probation
- Court Costs of $343.00 (includes DVSurcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.    Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Domestic violence counseling.  No violent contact with Nicole G.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service as a condition of probation.
 -  20 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion.

Defendant Antoine D Washington in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date. Court grants request and will give a date in one week. Defense to advise on the next date how this matter will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antoine D Washington in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date in 4 weeks. Defendant needs to meet with alliance counseling. Cpurt grants request. Defense to advise on the next date how they will proceed. - plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Antoine D Washington in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense addresses the pretrial offer. Court will give a new date in 30 days. Defense to let the Court know on the next date if this matter will be set for a plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Antoine D Washington in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
